democraticSystems.description: Citizens directly participate in decision-making processes.
Citizens elect representatives to make decisions on their behalf.
A monarch acts as the head of state within the parameters of a constitution.

nonDemocraticSystems.description: Power is concentrated in the hands of a single leader or a small group, with limited political freedoms.
The government seeks to control all aspects of public and private life.
A small group of people, often from the same social, economic, or political class, hold power.
Decision-makers are selected based on their expertise in a particular area.
Religious leaders control the government, and state policies are based on religious principles.
A single leader holds absolute power, often coming to power through non-democratic means.
The monarch has almost complete control over the government and is not bound by a constitution.

otherTypes.description: The state plans and controls the economy, and a single, often authoritarian party holds power.
One country controls another, often exploiting it economically.
Power is held by the nobility.
Power is divided between a central government and various regional governments.
The government owns and controls the means of production and distribution of goods.
